intro: Antennaria parlinii subsp. parlinii, commonly known as Parlin's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-white flowers in clustered inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its botanical structure is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
